meanings.sent1: The flower died after the harsh winter.
meanings.sent2: My pet fish died last night.
meanings.sent3: The battery in my toy car died just when I was winning the race.
meanings.sent4: The fire in the fireplace died down slowly, leaving only glowing embers.
meanings.sent5: The old tree in the backyard died peacefully, surrounded by its fallen leaves.

meanings.sent1: Grandma died in her sleep, surrounded by family.
meanings.sent2: The candle died out as the wax melted away.
meanings.sent3: The phone battery died right before I could save the important message.
meanings.sent4: The music faded away as the song died down.
meanings.sent5: The hope in his eyes died slowly as reality set in.

meanings.definition: To suffer extinction or decrease in intensity.
meanings.sent1: The laughter died down as the serious topic was introduced.
meanings.sent2: The excitement in the room died out when the event got canceled.
meanings.sent3: The noise from the party died down as the clock struck midnight.
meanings.sent4: The argument died out as both sides realized they were wrong.
meanings.sent5: The enthusiasm for the project died slowly as obstacles kept appearing.
